title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: NIH shake-up to grant decision-making draws concerns of political meddling
items.description: Policy drops “paylines” based on peer-review scores and requires geography and other factors to guide approvals

items.title: Popular obesity drug fails in hotly anticipated Alzheimer’s trials
items.description: The studies may still hold clues to the powers and limits of GLP-1 drugs

items.title: New vapor tool fights mosquitoes by slowly releasing insecticide in homes. Will it catch on?
items.description: World Health Organization supports “spatial repellents” to prevent malaria, but it’s unclear who will pay for them

items.title: Can a smaller U.S. National Academies remain relevant?
items.description: Loss of federal support leads to staff layoffs and fewer committees of outside experts

items.title: Global carbon emissions will soon flatten or decline
items.description: With China’s surge in renewable energy, greenhouse gases are reaching a turning point

items.title: Airplane contrails may not be the climate villain once feared
items.description: Studies raise questions about the benefits of adjusting flight paths to minimize heat-trapping clouds

items.title: Exclusive: CDC to end all monkey research
items.description: Studies related to HIV and other infectious diseases will be phased out, sources say; fate of the agency's animals remains unclear

items.title: In red states, many academic researchers feel fear–and resolve
items.description: State-level mandates prompt changes and small acts of resistance at universities

items.title: Headless bodies hint at why Europe’s first farmers vanished
items.description: Wave of mass brutality accompanied the collapse of the first pan-European culture

items.title: Pigeons sense Earth’s magnetic field in an entirely new way
items.description: Specialized hair cells pick electric currents induced by magnetism
